data.title: The Australia Post Australian Legends Award
data.meta_description: The Australia Post Australian Legends Award is presented annually by Australia Post to honour a living individual or group of individuals who have excelled in a particular field of endeavour.
data.text:
The Australia Post Australian Legends Award is presented annually by Australia Post to honour a living individual or group of individuals who have excelled in a particular field of endeavour. The award recognises outstanding individuals for their part in shaping the social and cultural life of Australia.

The Legends Award criteria recognises Australians who exemplify traits such as tenacity, imagination, perseverance, devotion, integrity and compassion.

In recognition of the honour, each recipient is depicted on a postage stamp and is presented with a 24-carat-gold replica of the stamp on which they appear.

When the inaugural Australian Legends Award was presented to Sir Donald Bradman in 1997, he became the first living Australian to be honoured on an Australian stamp. Prior to that, the only living people featured in their own right on our nation’s postage stamps were members of the royal family.

Recipients of the Australia Post Australian Legends Award:

Allan Moffat OBE

Dick Johnson AM

Mark Skaife OAM

Craig Lowndes OAM
